metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8397 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.28, is vulnerable to an invalid read of size 1 and an invalid write of size 1 during processing of a corrupt binary containing reloc(s) with negative addresses. This vulnerability causes programs that conduct an analysis of binary programs using the libbfd library, such as objdump, to crash.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Manh-Dung Nguyen, Marcel BÃ¶hme, and Van-Thuan Pham

criterions.comment: binutils: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
